column1: Pombal (Portuguese pronunciation: [põˈbal] (listen)) is a city and a municipality located in the Leiria District in the sub region of Pinhal Litoral in Portugal. The population in 2011 was 55
column3: in an area of 626.00 km². The population of the city of Pombal proper is about 18

column1: The municipality is served by a main railway station.
The Mayor is Luís Diogo de Paiva Morão Alves Mateus since 2013
column2: elected by the Social Democratic Party. The municipal holiday is November 11 and celebrates St. Martin's Day.
the municipality is divided into 13 civil parishes (freguesias):
